title: Bandbox And Lid, "A Peep at the Moon", 1835–40
medium: Block-printed on handmade paper, pasteboard support
provenance: From the Alexander Wilson Drake Collection.   Drake Number: 232.
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Box shows houses and trees, with a hot air balloon; legend: "Clayton's Ascent." Lid features legend: "A Peep at the Moon." A telescope, attached to a skeleton framework, is focused on the moon.  Life on the moon is plainly visible. Three aeronautical figures with wings are engaged in temporal pursuits. A lamb appears in the foreground with palm trees and volcano in the background. Printed in pink, white and green on a cream field.

tombstone.epitaph:
Bandbox And Lid, "A Peep at the Moon", 1835–40.
1835–40. Block-printed on handmade paper, pasteboard support. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1917-36-2-a,b.
